p: One recent association between PD and T2DM is the ADTIQ (1-acetyl-6,7-dihydroxy-1,2,3,4-tetrahydroisoquinoline) and its precursor methylglyoxal (a subproduct of glucose metabolism that is increased in diabetic patients) [ 149]. ADTIQ was recently discovered in frozen human PD brain tissues [ 150], and its role could be as an endogenous neurotoxin that causes PD [ 151]. In diabetic rats, it was observed that the accumulation of ADTIQ, produced by the reaction of dopamine and methylglyoxal, caused neuronal injury, oxidative stress, and apoptosis [ 41, 42]. Therefore, it is possible that ADTIQ may be an important factor to increase the risk of PD in patients with T2DM.
